column2: RHODE ISLAND DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 2. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column6: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: speed up to beat the red light.
column10: be prepared to stop before the intersection.

column2: 3. A broken yellow line between two lanes of traffic means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 4. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.
column8: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
